item.title: Comment on Photo Vault app still pwnable in 2021? An adventure in iOS RE by Mike Williamson
item.dc:creator: Mike Williamson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2019/06/26/ios-photo-vault-app-still-pwnable-in-2019/#comment-453">BHarr</a>.
Hi, everything you need to perform decryption should be contained in the backup. I need to update this post a little as PPV has changed things recently (Aug 2021).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to BHarr.

Hi, everything you need to perform decryption should be contained in the backup. I need to update this post a little as PPV has changed things recently (Aug 2021).

item.title: Comment on Photo Vault app still pwnable in 2021? An adventure in iOS RE by BHarr
item.dc:creator: BHarr
item.description: I had private photo vault on my old iphonex and before I traded it in , I made sure to do an iCloud backup and an iTunes backup on my MacBook Air. I now have an iPhone pro max 12 and when I added everything from my old phone to this one, in private photo vault , everything didnâ€™t transfer over; please help!
item.content:encoded: I had private photo vault on my old iphonex and before I traded it in , I made sure to do an iCloud backup and an iTunes backup on my MacBook Air. I now have an iPhone pro max 12 and when I added everything from my old phone to this one, in private photo vault , everything didnâ€™t transfer over; please help!

item.title: Comment on Photo Vault app still pwnable in 2021? An adventure in iOS RE by Cmonet
item.dc:creator: Cmonet
item.description: I Hey Mike, I really appreciate the write up on this. I'm in the same boat as Matt K. above. I have an iPhone backup that I've extracted the PPV app data from and need some assistance decrypting it. Any help would be greatly appreciated. I'll reach out via Discord also. Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
I Hey Mike,
I really appreciate the write up on this. I’m in the same boat as Matt K. above. I have an iPhone backup that I’ve extracted the PPV app data from and need some assistance decrypting it. Any help would be greatly appreciated. I’ll reach out via Discord also. Thanks!

item.title: Comment on iOS Photos.sqlite Forensics by CL
item.dc:creator: CL
item.description: Really interesting read Mike. I'm just getting into looking at photos.sqlite, Does IOS actually store any images in photos.sqlite, as BLOBs? If so do you have any recommendations on how to extract if I'm using commandline or sqlitestudio...it's all I have at the moment.
item.content:encoded: Really interesting read Mike. I’m just getting into looking at photos.sqlite, Does IOS actually store any images in photos.sqlite, as BLOBs? If so do you have any recommendations on how to extract if I’m using commandline or sqlitestudio…it’s all I have at the moment.

item.title: Comment on Photo Vault app still pwnable in 2021? An adventure in iOS RE by Peter M
item.dc:creator: Peter M
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2019/06/26/ios-photo-vault-app-still-pwnable-in-2019/#comment-402">Mike Williamson</a>.
Hi Mike,
Really interesting blog post!
I have similiar problem as Matt. I still have my old iphone backup but switched to android so I cant restore the PPV app.
Is there a way to extract the key from the keychain-backup.plist somehow?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Mike Williamson.

Hi Mike,

Really interesting blog post!

I have similiar problem as Matt. I still have my old iphone backup but switched to android so I cant restore the PPV app.

Is there a way to extract the key from the keychain-backup.plist somehow?

item.title: Comment on iOS Photos.sqlite Forensics by Ryan
item.dc:creator: Ryan
item.description: I have this database how do I pull up the photos? Are they displayed in the database?
item.content:encoded: I have this database how do I pull up the photos? Are they displayed in the database?

item.content:encoded:

item.title: Comment on Obtain a logical dump of Signal data on Android with signal-back by Mike Williamson
item.dc:creator: Mike Williamson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2019/05/15/obtain-logical-signal-android/#comment-362">Retired Hacker</a>.
You are correct! Good news though if you have access AXIOM, we are able to decrypt the backups directly now.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Retired Hacker.

You are correct! Good news though if you have access AXIOM, we are able to decrypt the backups directly now.

item.title: Comment on Photo Vault app still pwnable in 2021? An adventure in iOS RE by Matt K
item.dc:creator: Matt K
item.description: Hi Mike, Thanks for your detailed code . I used to have that app and since it got discontinued and I upgraded to a new phone I have lost all the data as I am unable to get/acces PPV app. Is there any way to extract the data from Iphone backup instead?
item.content:encoded:
Hi Mike,
Thanks for your detailed code .
I used to have that app and since it got discontinued and I upgraded to a new phone I have lost all the data as I am unable to get/acces PPV app.
Is there any way to extract the data from Iphone backup instead?
